1.Cons: Rude CustomersHectic Rushes during busy hours

2.Pros: Pay above minimum wageFriendly to customers
2.Cons: Many managers seem to struggle under pressure. They can keep calm by being nice to customers but when customers are not near and they are busy, they tend to be rude to employees. These make me feel like I do not have potential. They mainly tend to not encourage me to do better.

6.Summary: "There are much better places to work."
6.Pros: *Great co-workers, they are some truly great people*Awesome regular customers, every day we see them
6.Cons: *No Benefits*Lack of pay, minimum wage (sure managers make more than crew, but at my store, we have managers who are making less than 70% of the crew)*Franchise stores are owned by actual owners and not corporate, the owners can basically set their own rules, pay, and treat people however they please.*No respect from upper management*A bad stigma around McDonald's and its crew (which is mostly not true, except for a few bad eggs) that customers use to the extreme*CUSTOMERS. While some are pleasant and awesome, some are downright awful.*Drugs, I have had people passed out in my restroom floors, I have found needles in the restroom trash cans, and I have found a dead body in a car sitting in the parking lot.

7.Cons: Horrible pay not sure how staff are maintains there bills

8.Cons: The shift hours are all over

9.Pros: ... made enough money to buy things I wanted but didn't want to ask parents for
